{{Han etyl}}

==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=uc|rs=火14}}

# [[wildfire]]
# [[backburn]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[せん]] (sen)
|kanon=[[せん]] (sen)
|kun=[[のび]] (nobi), [[ぬび]] (nubi, ''obsolete'') [[ほそけ]] (hosoke)
}}

====Compounds====
* {{ja-r|兵燹|へいせん}} {{qualifier|rare}}: a [[fire]] caused by war; by extension, a [[battle]]

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=kun|のび}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=のび|野|tr1=no|t1=field|火|tr2=hi|t2=fire}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=のび|hi|bi}}

An ancient variant seen in eastern Japan uses the dialectal reading ''nu'' for {{m|ja|野}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Use of this kanji {{lang|ja|燹}} is rare, and is an example of [[熟字訓#Japanese|jukujikun]]. The standard spelling is {{m|ja|野火}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|のび|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|のび}} {{lb|ja|rare|sort=のび}}

{{ja-noun|ぬび}} {{lb|ja|obsolete|sort=ぬび}}

# a [[wildfire]]

=====Alternative forms=====
* {{l|ja|野火}} {{qualifier|standard spelling}}

=====Usage notes=====
Spelled using this kanji, {{lang|ja|燹}} excludes the "''controlled agricultural burn''" sense found found under the {{l|ja|野火}} spelling.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ほそけ}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ほそけ|火|tr1=ho|t1=fire|退く|tr2=soku|t2=to push away, to make distant}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

The [[kun'yomi]] for {{m|ja|火}} is usually ''hi'', but it can appear as ''ho'' or ''fu'', particularly in older compounds.

The ''soku'' changes to ''soke'' due to [[conjugation]] of the verb. Grammatically, the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of ''soke'' indicates the transitive.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Use of this kanji {{lang|ja|燹}} is rare, and is an example of [[熟字訓|jukujikun]]. The more common spelling is {{m|ja|火退}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ほそけ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ほそけ}} {{lb|ja|rare|sort=ほそけ}}

# a [[backburn]]: a [[controlled]] fire deliberately set in the path of a [[wildfire]] to create a [[firebreak]] by removing [[combustible]] material

=====Alternative forms=====
* {{l|ja|火退}} {{qualifier|rare}}
* {{l|ja|逆焼}} {{qualifier|rare}}
* {{l|ja|野火}} {{qualifier|rare}}

=====Usage notes=====
The more common word for this is {{m|ja|向火}}, {{ja-r|向かい火|むかいび}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

=====Synonyms=====
* {{m|ja|向火}}, {{ja-r|向かい火|むかいび}}
